intro: Pseudanthistiria intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate pseudanthistiria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often arranged in umbellate inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
